page.title: 06HOUSING in GLAMIS
page.content: The houses in Glamis are a mixture of old stone built houses, mainly owned by Strathmore Estates Holdings Ltd and dating from the mid 1700's, and modern housing schemes built by the Local Authority in the 1960's and 1970's. Both types of house are now being sold to private householders. The houses in Charleston are now mainly owner occupied. There are a number of scattered farm houses and farm cottages. Only a few occupied houses in the area have not been modernised to include inside toilet and bathroom. There is no serious problem of overcrowding or housing shortage in the area. There are no current plans for further housing developement.
